meanings.definition: relating to a senator or the senate
meanings.sent1: The senatorial debate was intense and focused on important issues.
meanings.sent2: The senatorial election drew a lot of attention from the public.
meanings.sent3: The senatorial candidates joked about having a race in their office chairs.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was senatorial, commanding respect and authority.
meanings.sent5: The senatorial chambers echoed with the voices of passionate lawmakers.

meanings.definition: characteristic of a senator or the senate
meanings.sent1: His demeanor was calm and senatorial, reflecting his experience in politics.
meanings.sent2: The senatorial speech was eloquent and persuasive.
meanings.sent3: The senatorial handshake was firm and reassuring.
meanings.sent4: The senatorial presence in the room demanded attention.
meanings.sent5: The senatorial attire exuded professionalism and dignity.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the senate or its members
meanings.sent1: The senatorial committee discussed the new bill thoroughly.
meanings.sent2: The senatorial meeting was scheduled for next week.
meanings.sent3: The senatorial luncheon featured speeches and networking opportunities.
meanings.sent4: The senatorial decision was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent5: The senatorial responsibilities included representing the constituents faithfully.
